SUPPORT_TEXT: When someone is afraid, they feel fear.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The woman was afraid of what she saw.

SUPPORT_TEXT: To agree is to say, 'yes' or to think the same way.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: A: The food is very good in that restaurant.

SUPPORT_TEXT: When someone is angry, they may want to speak loudly or fight.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: She didn?t do her homework, so her father is angry.

SUPPORT_TEXT: To arrive is to get to or reach some place.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The bus always arrives at the corner of my street at 4:00

SUPPORT_TEXT: To attack is to try to fight or to hurt.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The man with the sword attacked the other man first.

SUPPORT_TEXT: The bottom is the lowest part.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The bottom of my shoe has a hole in it.

SUPPORT_TEXT: When someone is clever, they can solve a hard puzzle or problem.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The clever boy thought of a good idea.

SUPPORT_TEXT: When someone is cruel, they do bad things to hurt others.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The cruel man yelled at his sister.

SUPPORT_TEXT: If something happens finally, it happens after a longtime or at the end.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: He finally crossed the finish line after five hours of running.

SUPPORT_TEXT: To hide is to try not to let others see you.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The other children will hide while you count to 100.

SUPPORT_TEXT: To hunt is to look for or search for an animal to kill.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: Long ago, people hunted with bows and arrows.

SUPPORT_TEXT: A lot means as large number or amount of people, animal, things, etc.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: There are a lot of apples in the basket.

SUPPORT_TEXT: The middle of something is the center or halfway point.
SAMPLE_SENTENCE: The Canadian flag has a maple leaf in the middle of it.
